title: Ticket #1891: condor_config_val -set/-rset need syntax validation
description:
for i in x y z; do
condor_config_val -neg -set '$i_limit' 300
done
condor_reconfig -negotiator

This caused the negotiator to exit:
Configuration Error Line 0 while reading persistent config
source: /opt/condor/persist//.config.NEGOTIATOR.$i_limit

Reproduce with -

config -

ALLOW_CONFIG = *
SETTABLE_ATTRS_CONFIG = *
ENABLE_PERSISTENT_CONFIG = TRUE
PERSISTENT_CONFIG_DIR = /tmp

command -

condor_config_val -sched -set '$=1' ; condor_reconfig -sched

Also reproducible with -rset -

config -

(comment 2's and)
ENABLE_RUNTIME_CONFIG = TRUE

command -

condor_config_val -sched -rset '$=1' ; condor_reconfig -sched

SchedLog -

Configuration Error Line 0 while reading /tmp/cndrtmp8HTtzd, runtime config: $

Using 7.5.5 source -

condor_utils/config.cpp's Read_config validates param names with,

 /* Check that "name" is a legal identifier : only
    alphanumeric characters and _ allowed*/
 ptr = name;
 while( *ptr ) {
  char c = *ptr++;
  if( !ISIDCHAR(c) ) {
   fprintf( stderr,
 "Configuration Error File <%s>, Line %d: Illegal Identifier: <%s>\n",
    config_source, ConfigLineNo, name );
   retval = -1;
   goto cleanup;
  }
 }

condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core_main.cpp has a handle_config() function that
handles both persistent and runtime configuration changes. It checks to see if
the param can be changed, but does not do any other validation. It could.

condor_tools/config_val.cpp's SetRemoteParam() does an incomplete validation of
the param,

  // At this point, in either set or unset mode, param_name
  // should hold a valid name, so do a final check to make sure
  // there are no spaces.
 if( (tmp = strchr(param_name, ' ')) ) {
  fprintf( stderr,
     "%s: Error: Configuration variable names cannot contain spaces\n",
     MyName );
  my_exit( 1 );
 }

To fix this both Daemon Core and condor_config_val should be changed. DC needs
to protect itself from bad input, especially from unpatched condor_config_val.
condor_config_val needs to be patched to properly validate the param name,
primarily to give useful feedback to its user.
